Feature: Stereotypical behavior attributed to specific ethnic groups in social settings.
Assertiveness vs. docility often highlighted in women of different ethnic backgrounds.
Women being judged on their loudness or quietness more frequently than men.
Arab individuals depicted as more quiet or reserved.
Negative connotations often associated with less conventional attractiveness (e.g., non-Western beauty standards).
Stereotypes about smell linked to South Asian and Eastern European men.
Quietness often attributed to Asian or Arab individuals.
